poll_list.title: Ratification Poll for Onboarding Retro as CES-001 Facilitator (MIP41c4-SP40) - March 13, 2023

discourse_list.title: MIP41c4-SP40: Onboarding Retro as CES-001 Facilitator

content.content: MIP41c4-SP40: Onboarding Retro as CES-001 Facilitator  Preamble MIP41c4-SP#: 40 Author(s): @juan Contributors:  Tags: core-unit, cu-ces-001, facilitator Status: Formal Submission Date Applied: 2022-11-22 Date Ratified: <yyyy-mm-dd> Forum URL: https://forum.makerdao.com/t/mip41c4-sp40-onboarding-retro-as-ces-001-facilitator/18887 Ratification Poll URL:   Sentence Summary MIP41c4-SP40 onboards Retro as Facilitator for the Collateral Engineering Services Core Unit.  Specification  Motivation Following the recent self-offboarding of the previous CES-001 Facilitator, and after what it looks like a successful interim process, I am proposing @Retro  for the Core Unit Facilitator role.  Retaining Valuable Talent Retention of valuable talent is crucial to the success Maker. The commitment and skills of the CES team can help tackle the next milestones for the Endgame  and as well as the technical side of collateral onboarding, governance security, among others.  Retro  Retro has shown the thoroughness to make sense of a messy transition while blending in with the team. He has shown passion and commitment since the beginning. Retro has shown possibly the most tenacity that Maker has ever seen. It seems hard to remember someone that has joined and so quickly became involved helping wherever he was needed. Retro has re-enabled the key resources at the Core Unit to deliver on their mandate and guided the team to continue serving the DAO.   Core Unit ID  CES-001   Facilitator name and information  Name: Retro Maker Forum handle: @Retro  Twitter account: @0xRetro  Github account: @0xRetro  Discord account: @Retro#1428   Facilitator commitment As a facilitator of this Core Unit, I understand that I play a critical role in building and maintaining a healthy and productive Core Unit. I commit to the following:  Facilitation: I will be responsible for facilitating discussions, decision-making, and conflict resolution within the Core Unit and with the DAO. This includes creating agendas, moderating meetings, and ensuring that the stakeholders have an opportunity to participate. Communication: I will maintain regular communication with the stakeholders, keeping them informed about ongoing projects, decisions, and updates. Accountability: I will be accountable to Governance and act in their best interests. This includes ensuring that decisions are made transparently and fairly, and that conflicts are resolved in a timely and respectful manner. Leadership: I will be a leader in the DAO and set an example for other members. This includes modeling behavior that fosters collaboration, inclusivity, and respect. Time commitment: I understand that I need to commit a significant amount of time to the role, including attending regular meetings, responding to messages and emails, and staying up-to-date on relevant discussions and decisions.  By accepting this role, I am committing to these expectations and responsibilities. I value my contribution to our DAO and look forward to working with others to build a successful and thriving community.  Facilitator Credentials  Operations Wizard before Maker SES Intern CES Interim Facilitator
content.GPT-summary: The post is a formal submission of a proposal to onboard Retro as the Facilitator for the Collateral Engineering Services Core Unit. The author explains the motivation behind the proposal, which is to retain valuable talent and ensure the success of Maker. The post also includes Retro's credentials and commitment as a facilitator. A 3rd party gives entirely positive feedback on Retro's skills and commitment, and extends support to the proposal. There is no negative feedback or criticism of the proposal.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
3rd party or author wants to collaborate on proposal
None

content.content: Edit: I withdraw my nomination, and intent to pursue this role. See Fallback Interim Facilitator Selection Process - CES-001 - #27 by lollike

I had a pleasure of working with Nikolaj Lollike for several years at the Maker Foundation, and agree with Juan’s point that @lollike is an excellent candidate thanks to his humbleness and also deep understanding of the Maker protocol.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving entirely positive feedback on proposal
3rd party extending to proposal

content.content: I have also had the opportunity to work with @lollike in my interactions with CES, particularly in the SocGen and HVB transactions. @lollike brings a wealth of Maker related experience to the table and, from my interactions on the HVB deal, he identified and worked with me and the CES team in resolving some key crypto-related commercial issues. While I believe that @lollike can grow into a leadership position with the right amount of support, I do not personally know if he has, today, the finance-related background to manage the “real world” aspects of RWAs. These management experiences are typically “learned” through trial and error. This would be my only hesitation if the role of CES will continue to be like “teeth to gums” with the transaction-team in reviewing and executing on transactions with arrangers or otherwise. Again, as I have no formal existing or prospective role with Maker (or the MetaDAOs), this opinion is in my personal capacity only.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving entirely positive feedback on proposal

content.content: ANy TDLR on the historical events of CES-001 which led to its current state?

Hey Christian - thanks for your input and the kind words.     christiancdpetersen:  I do not personally know if he has, today, the finance-related background to manage the “real world” aspects of RWAs. These management experiences are typically “learned” through trial and error. This would be my only hesitation if the role of CES will continue to be like “teeth to gums” with the transaction-team in reviewing and executing on transactions with arrangers or otherwise.   All work related to the management of the business side of RWAs has already been offboarded from CES, and was never part of the CES mandate. So I have no intent to get involved with this specific work domain. The ongoing work in the Collateral Engineering Services CU is primarily of technical nature, focused on delivering smart contract work such as deploying new crypto collateral types, RWA vaults, and executive spells. I am entirely equipped to lead this work as I have already been doing this the past year at CES. Furthermore I have previous leadership experience from the Maker Foundation where I managed a similar sized engineering team. I will post my credentials in the top post later today.

content.content: Hola @juan, Since @Retro has now been voted as the Interim Facilitator for CES-001, with your agreement, I will mark this proposal as “Withdrawn”. Let me know if you have any questions/comments. Thanks

content.content: What’s happening with the onboarding of a permanent facilitator?    MIP105: The Real-World Asset Collateral Scope Framework   MIP105c4: Active Responsible Facilitator Core Unit list The current active Responsible Facilitator Core Units of the Real-World Asset Collateral Scope are:  Collateral Engineering Services    On yesterday’s DVC call @Rune mentioned @Retro would be doing this work. Seems like a massive responsibility that needs a full-time long-term dedicated person. Retro already is fully occupied with the broader ecosystem works, including DLO processes. As for @lollike, the role is no longer as follows:     lollike:  The ongoing work in the Collateral Engineering Services CU is primarily of technical nature, focused on delivering smart contract work such as deploying new crypto collateral types, RWA vaults, and executive spells.   What’s contemplated by MIP105 will require a unique set of skills, subject matter knowledge and experience in dealing at an executive level with sophisticated “Real World” counterparties and their advisors. Qualification expectations for all the new Endgame roles is an important discussion to have and include in the Scopes.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving entirely positive feedback on proposal
3rd party extending support to proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: I think the request on  MIP105c4 is just an operational task to offboard certain collateral. The “unique set of skills, subject matter knowledge and experience in dealing at an executive level with sophisticated “Real World” counterparties and their advisors” is needed when defining the strategy for collateral portfolio management and assessing each collateral, offboarding is a methodical work that is operational at best. I do agree that Retro could be stretched too far by having this new responsibility, but not in the qualifications.
